intro: Strobilanthes arguta, commonly known as the "Saddleback" or "Hairy Saddleback," is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its unique, showy inflorescences that resemble a saddle shape. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Strobilanthes arguta is also noted for its short blooming period, which occurs during the rainy season.
